specJson.name: brightics.function.clustering$spectral_clustering
specJson.description:
Clustering is one of the main tasks in unsupervised machine learning. The goal is to assign unlabeled data to groups, where similar data points get assigned to the same group. Spectral clustering is a technique with roots in graph theory, where the approach is used to identify communities of nodes in a graph based on the edges connecting them. The method is flexible and allows us to cluster non-graph data as well.

Spectral clustering make use of the spectrum(eigenvalues) of the similarity matrix of the data to perform dimensinality reduction before cluster in fewer dimensions. The similarity matrix is provided as an input and consists of a quantitative assessment of the relative similarity of each pair of points in the dataset. In practice, spectral clustering is very useful when the structure of the individual clusters is highly non-convex or more generally when a mesure of the center and spread of the cluster is not a suitable description of the complete cluster.

Reference
+ <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spectral_clustering>
+ <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/clustering.html#spectral-clustering>
+ <http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/summary?doi=10.1.1.165.9323>

params.label: Input Columns
params.description: Columns to select as input. Only values in numeric type are possible.

params.label: N Clusters
params.description: The dimension of the projection subspace.

params.label: Eigen Solver
params.description:
The eigenvalue decomposition strategy to use.
   - Available Options : `None`, `arpack`, `lobpcg`

params.label: Seed
params.description: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results.

params.label: N Init
params.description: Number of time the k-means algorithm will be run with different centroid seeds. The final results will be the best output of `N Init` consecutive runs in terms of inertia.

params.label: Affinity
params.description:
How to construct the affinity matrix. `nearest_neighbors` contructs the affinity matrix by computing a graph of nearest nighbors. `precomputed` interpret input as a precomputed affinity matrix. `rbf` constructs the affinity matrix using a radial basis function kernel
   - Available Options : `nearest_neighbors`, `precomputed`, `rbf`, `amg`, `poly`, `sigmoid`, `polynomial`, `laplacian`, `chi2`

params.label: N Neighbors
params.description: Number of neighbors to use when constructing the `Affinity` is `nearest_neighbors`.

params.label: Eigen Tolerance
params.description: Stopping criterion for eigendecomposition of the Laplacian matrix when `eigen_solver='arpack'.

params.label: Assign Labels
params.description:
The strategy to use to assign labels in the embedding space. There are two ways to assign labels after the laplacian embedding. `kmeans` can be applied and is a popular choice. But it can also be sensitive to initialization. `discretize` is another approach which is less sensitive to random initialization.
    - Available Options : `kmeans`, `discretize`

params.label: Degree
params.description: Degree of the polynomial kernel. Ignored by other kernels.

params.label: Zero Coefficient
params.description: Zero coefficient for polynomial and sigmoid kernels.

summary.en: This function trains a spectral clustering model and predicts cluster label.
summary.ko: 스펙트럼 군집 모델을 학습하고 군집 레이블을 예측합니다.

md.en:
# Spectral Clustering This function trains a spectral clustering model and predicts cluster label. ## Description Clustering is one of the main tasks in unsupervised machine learning. The goal is to assign unlabeled data to groups, where similar data points get assigned to the same group. Spectral clustering is a technique with roots in graph theory, where the approach is used to identify communities of nodes in a graph based on the edges connecting them. The method is flexible and allows us to cluster non-graph data as well. Spectral clustering make use of the spectrum(eigenvalues) of the similarity matrix of the data to perform dimensinality reduction before cluster in fewer dimensions. The similarity matrix is provided as an input and consists of a quantitative assessment of the relative similarity of each pair of points in the dataset. In practice, spectral clustering is very useful when the structure of the individual clusters is highly non-convex or more generally when a mesure of the center and spread of the cluster is not a suitable description of the complete cluster. Reference + + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (Table) A result table that contains input table and cluster label. 2. **model**: (Model) Trained Spectral Clustering model. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: Columns to select as input. Only values in numeric type are possible. 2. **Prediction Column Name**: Column name for prediction. 3. **N Clusters**: The dimension of the projection subspace. 4. **Eigen Solver**: The eigenvalue decomposition strategy to use. - Available Options : `None`, `arpack`, `lobpcg` 5. **Seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. 6. **N Init**: Number of time the k-means algorithm will be run with different centroid seeds. The final results will be the best output of `N Init` consecutive runs in terms of inertia. 7. **Gamma**: Kernel coefficient for `rbf`, `poly`, `sigmoid`, `laplacian` and `chi2` kernels. 8. **Affinity**: How to construct the affinity matrix. `nearest_neighbors` contructs the affinity matrix by computing a graph of nearest nighbors. `precomputed` interpret input as a precomputed affinity matrix. `rbf` constructs the affinity matrix using a radial basis function kernel - Available Options : `nearest_neighbors`, `precomputed`, `rbf`, `amg`, `poly`, `sigmoid`, `polynomial`, `laplacian`, `chi2` 9. **N Neighbors**: Number of neighbors to use when constructing the `Affinity` is `nearest_neighbors`. 10. **Assign Labels**: The strategy to use to assign labels in the embedding space. There are two ways to assign labels after the laplacian embedding. `kmeans` can be applied and is a popular choice. But it can also be sensitive to initialization. `discretize` is another approach which is less sensitive to random initialization. - Available Options : `kmeans`, `discretize` 11. **Zero Coefficient**: Zero coefficient for polynomial and sigmoid kernels. 12. **Group By**: Columns to group by. ### Python #### USAGE ``` spectral_clustering(table, input_cols, prediction_col='prediction', n_clusters=8, eigen_solver=None, random_state=None, n_init=10, gamma=1.0, affinity='rbf', n_neighbors=10, eigen_tol=0.0, assign_labels='kmeans', degree=3, coef0=1, group_by=None) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (Table) A result table that contains input table and cluster label. 2. **model**: (Model) Trained Spectral Clustering model. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: Columns to select as input. Only values in numeric type are possible. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **prediction_col**: Column name for prediction. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: prediction 3. **n_clusters**: The dimension of the projection subspace. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 8 (value >= 1) 4. **eigen_solver**: The eigenvalue decomposition strategy to use. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: None ( None | arpack | lobpcg ) 5. **random_state**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. * Type: *int* 6. **n_init**: Number of time the k-means algorithm will be run with different centroid seeds. The final results will be the best output of `n_init` consecutive runs in terms of inertia. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 7. **gamma**: Kernel coefficient for `rbf`, `poly`, `sigmoid`, `laplacian` and `chi2` kernels. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1.0 8. **affinity**: How to construct the affinity matrix. `nearest_neighbors` contructs the affinity matrix by computing a graph of nearest nighbors. `precomputed` interpret input as a precomputed affinity matrix. `rbf` constructs the affinity matrix using a radial basis function kernel * Type: *str* * Default / Range: rbf ( nearest_neighbors | precomputedrbf | rbf | amg | poly | sigmoid | polynomial | laplacian | chi2 ) 9. **n_neighbors**: Number of neighbors to use when constructing the `affinity` is `nearest_neighbors`. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 10. **eigen_tol**: Stopping criterion for eigendecomposition of the Laplacian matrix when `eigen_solver='arpack'. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.0 11. **assign_labels**: The strategy to use to assign labels in the embedding space. There are two ways to assign labels after the laplacian embedding. `kmeans` can be applied and is a popular choice. But it can also be sensitive to initialization. `discretize` is another approach which is less sensitive to random initialization. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: kmeans ( kmeans | discretize ) 12. **degree**: Degree of the polynomial kernel. Ignored by other kernels. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 3 13. **coef0**: Zero coefficient for polynomial and sigmoid kernels. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1 14. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* ## Example ### VA **[Related Tutorial]** **[Sample Model]**
In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used in the Spectral Clustering function. The generated table shows cluster label for each data point. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 3. **N Clusters**: 3 4. **Eigen Solver**: None 5. **Seed**: None 6. **N Init**: 10 7. **Gamma**: 1.0 8. **Affinity**: rbf 9. **N Neighbors**: 10 10. **Assign Labels**: kmeans 11. **Zero Coefficient**: 1 12. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import spectral_clustering input_table = inputs[0] result = spectral_clustering(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_length', 'sepal_width'], prediction_col='prediction', n_clusters=3, eigen_solver=None, random_state=None, n_init=10, gamma=1.0, affinity='rbf', n_neighbors=10, eigen_tol=0.0, assign_labels='kmeans', degree=3, coef0=1, group_by=None) output_table = result['out_table'] output_model = result['model'] ```
In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used in the Spectral Clustering function. The generated table shows cluster label for each data point.
md.kr:
# 스펙트럼 군집화 Graph 기반의 클러스터링 기법 중 하나로, 데이터간의 유사성을 중심으로 모델을 훈련시키고 데이터를 분류 합니다. ## Description ### [사용하기 좋은 상황] 1. 데이터간의 유사성이 존재하는 경우 2. 데이터가 볼록집합이 아닌 경우 (Non-convex set) 3. 데이터가 중심을 가지고 확산하는 경우 ### [알고리즘 동작원리] 1. 각 데이터의 관계를 가지고 유사도 행열(affinity matrix)을 만든다. 단, 데이터 간에 관계가 주어지지 않은 경우 각 데이터를 노드, 거리를 엣지로 그래프를 구성 후 유사도 행열을 구한다 2. 유사도 행열을 가지고 차원축소를 진행한다 3. 새로 옴겨진 차원에서 데이터를 k-평균 기법을 통하여 데이터를 클러스터링 한다 ### [장점] 1. 데이터 분포와 상관없이 사용할 수 있다 2. 현실 데이터는 데이터간 관계가 존재하기 때문에(알 수 없더라도)자주 활용된다 ### [단점] 1. 최종적으로는 K-평균 기법을 사용하기 때문에, 항상 같은결과를 보장할 수 없다 2. 유사도 행열을 만들어야 하기 때문에 데이터가 많아질수록 계산량이 매우 증가한다 Reference + + + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: 입력 데이터 테이블 #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (table)결과 테이블. 입력 테이블의 데이터 외에 함수가 예측한 값을 컬럼에 포함한다. 2. **model**:(model)학습된 클러스터링 모델 #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: 알고리즘에 사용할 컬럼을 선택. 연속형숫자(numeric) 데이터만 가능 2. **Prediction Column Name**: 데이터 클러스터링 예측 컬럼의 이름 3. **N Clusters**: 몇개의 군집으로 클러스터링 할지 결정 4. **Eigen Solver**: 유사도 행열에서 차원축소 시, 사용할 추가 옵션 - Available Options : `None`, `arpack`, `lobpcg` 5. **Seed**: 랜덤 함수에서 사용할 Seed. 다른 사용자도 같은 결과를 내기 위하여 사용하는 옵션 값 6. **N Init**: K-평균 알고리즘에서 중심점으로 이동을 몇번할지 결정하는 옵션. 해당 횟수 내에서 최적의 값을 결과로 출력 7. **Gamma**: 커널 함수에서 사용할 γ(감마) 값 8. **Affinity**: 유사도 행열을 만들 때 사용하는 커널함수를 어떤 기준으로 만들지 결정하는 옵션 - Available Options : `nearest_neighbors`, `precomputed`, `rbf`, `amg`, `poly`, `sigmoid`, `polynomial`, `laplacian`, `chi2` 9. **N Neighbors**: 유사도 행열을 만드는 기준을 `nearest_neighbors` 했을 때, 얼만큼의 거리값 까지 관계가 있는지 결정하는 옵션 10. **Assign Labels**: 차원축소 이후 클러스터링을 진행하는 방법을 결정할 수 있는 옵션. 대부분 `kmeans` 기법을 많이 사용하지만 해당 기법은 초기값에 매우 민감하기 때문에 이럴경우, `discretize` 을 사용 - Available Options : `kmeans`, `discretize` 11. **Zero Coefficient**: 커널함수가 `polynomial` 또는 `sigmoid`일 때 사용할 사용할 θ 값 12. **Group By**: 그룹을 분류하기 위한 컬럼 이름. 그룹에 대해 해당 함수가 독립적으로 수행 ### Python #### USAGE ``` spectral_clustering(table, input_cols, prediction_col='prediction', n_clusters=8, eigen_solver=None, random_state=None, n_init=10, gamma=1.0, affinity='rbf', n_neighbors=10, eigen_tol=0.0, assign_labels='kmeans', degree=3, coef0=1, group_by=None) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 입력 데이터 테이블 #### OUTPUT 1. **table**: (Table) 결과 테이블. 입력 테이블의 데이터 외에 함수가 예측한 값을 컬럼에 포함한다. 2. **model**: (Model) 학습된 클러스터링 모델 #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: 알고리즘에 사용할 컬럼을 선택. 연속형숫자(numeric) 데이터만 가능 * Type: *list[str]* 2. **prediction_col**: 데이터 클러스터링 예측 컬럼의 이름 * Type: *str* * Default / Range: prediction 3. **n_clusters**: 몇개의 군집으로 클러스터링 할지 결정 * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 8 (value >= 1) 4. **eigen_solver**: 유사도 행열에서 차원축소 시, 사용할 추가 옵션 * Type: *str* * Default / Range: None ( None | arpack | lobpcg ) 5. **random_state**: 랜덤 함수에서 사용할 Seed. 다른 사용자도 같은 결과를 내기 위하여 사용하는 옵션 값 * Type: *int* 6. **n_init**: K-평균 알고리즘에서 중심점으로 이동을 몇번할지 결정하는 옵션. 해당 횟수 내에서 최적의 값을 결과로 출력 * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 7. **gamma**: 커널 함수에서 사용할 감마 값 * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1.0 8. **affinity**: 유사도 행열을 만들 때 사용하는 커널함수를 어떤 기준으로 만들지 결정하는 옵션 * Type: *str* * Default / Range: rbf ( nearest_neighbors | precomputedrbf | rbf | amg | poly | sigmoid | polynomial | laplacian | chi2 ) 9. **n_neighbors**:유사도 행열을 만드는 기준을 `nearest_neighbors` 했을 때, 얼만큼의 거리값 까지 관계가 있는지 결정하는 옵션 * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 10. **eigen_tol**: 유사도 행열에서 차원축소 시 사용할 옵션 중 `arpack`를 선택 했을때, 라플라이산 행열의 고유값분해 횟수 기준을 정하는 옵션 * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.0 11. **assign_labels**: 차원축소 이후 클러스터링을 진행하는 방법을 결정할 수 있는 옵션. 대부분 `kmeans` 기법을 많이 사용하지만 해당 기법은 초기값에 매우 민감하기 때문에 이럴경우, `discretize` 을 사용 * Type: *str* * Default / Range: kmeans ( kmeans | discretize ) 12. **degree**: 커널 함수가 `polynomial`일 때 사용할 차수 * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 3 13. **coef0**: 커널함수가 `polynomial` 또는 `sigmoid`일 때 사용할 사용할 θ 값 * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1 14. **group_by**: 그룹을 분류하기 위한 컬럼 이름. 그룹에 대해 해당 함수가 독립적으로 수행 * Type: *list[str]* ## Example ### VA **[Related Tutorial]** **[Sample Model]**
제공하고 있는 Sample 모델은 "sample_iris" 데이터를 기반으로 스팩트럼 클러스터링 모델을 제공합니다. 결과 테이블에는 predict 컬럼에 분류된 예측값이 있습니다. 해당 튜토리얼에 대하여 변수설정은 아래와 같습니다. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 3. **N Clusters**: 3 4. **Eigen Solver**: None 5. **Seed**: None 6. **N Init**: 10 7. **Gamma**: 1.0 8. **Affinity**: rbf 9. **N Neighbors**: 10 10. **Assign Labels**: kmeans 11. **Zero Coefficient**: 1 12. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import spectral_clustering input_table = inputs[0] result = spectral_clustering(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_length', 'sepal_width'], prediction_col='prediction', n_clusters=3, eigen_solver=None, random_state=None, n_init=10, gamma=1.0, affinity='rbf', n_neighbors=10, eigen_tol=0.0, assign_labels='kmeans', degree=3, coef0=1, group_by=None) output_table = result['out_table'] output_model = result['model'] ```

guide.message: Set data options using Chart Setting Button.
Set data options using Chart Setting Button.
